snippet: Some companies that powered the personal computer industry are notably absent from advances in cloud computing.
abstract: Some companies that powered the personal computer industry, like Dell and Hewlett-Packard, are notably absent from advances in cloud computing; analysts and cloud computing executives say these firms have to completely reimagine themselves, focusing on using their esoteric knowledge of how business uses technology, rather than how to make a cheaper PC.
lead_paragraph: Some companies that powered the personal computer industry are notably absent from advances in cloud computing.

headline.seo: Cloud Leaves Some Tech Giants Seeking a Silver Lining
headline.main: Cloud Leaves Some Tech Giants Seeking a Silver Lining
headline.print_headline: For Tech’s Elder Giants, It’s Harder to Find a Silver Lining
